intro: Microstylis latilabris, commonly known as the broad-lipped microstylis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as wetlands and forest understories. Microstylis latilabris is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
